story:
ABOUT CHULLACHAQUI LODGE

The mighty Amazon River flows past mythical forests and the reflection of the deep greens of the jungle and wide blue skies on the river’s dark water create a special magic. Here, biological diversity is at its riches, Pink Dolphins rule the river and lily pads grow as big as small pools. Sloth and Iguana are common jungle creatures, and the jewel-like colors of the bird life are stunning.

Our lodge is constructed primarily with local eco friendly materials, built in the traditional way, and we choose to use local labor from our surrounding communities. Our guests find the best of both worlds: comfort and great service and an opportunity to experience all that the Amazon has to offer!

 Eco-cultural activities are organized to promote sustainable tourism. Our local bilingual naturalist guides host excursions including: daily hikes in the jungle, birding, nocturnal activities, paddling dugout canoes, piranha fishing, tours to spot exotic animals including: sloths, caiman, pink and gray river dolphins, reptiles, amphibians, insects, all sorts of monkeys, birds and, of course, the flora including gorgeous flowers, impressive giant trees and the important medicinal plants of the rain forest.  We also visit nearby jungle communities, where we do many cooperative activities, this gives our guests an opportunity to personally met the native people and learn about their culture.


OUR CHALLENGES

Because of the economy, tourism in Iquitos is way down.  Gasoline prices are up, as are the costs of food, and upkeep of the lodge.  The lodge must be maintained at all times, as the jungle takes it back very quickly.  Our lodge is located 97 kilometers (60 miles) up the Amazon River from Iquitos, Peru.  This presents a challenge as the only way to reach the lodge is by our speed boat and it is very costly to operate our boat when we only have a few guests.  Our location is an ideal spot in primary rain forest in which to enjoy the Amazon River, the Rain Forest, its flora, fauna and its people.  We have to maintain minimum staff in the lodge at all times and we have to maintain a small office in Iquitos from which we operate.  We are in our second year of operation under the new ownership and we want to survive.  But it is becoming more difficult to keep the lodge open.  Most of our guests are referrals from former guests, or they find us when they arrive in Iquitos looking for the perfect lodge with the programs they want.


WHY THIS FUNDRAISER IS IMPORTANT TO ME! 

I turned my world upside down by using my retirement to purchase the lodge.  It is difficult for family and friends to understand why it is so important to me, but it is the epitome of my love of Peru and the Amazon Rain Forest.  It gives me a unique purpose that I have never before had.   When I purchased this lodge, I had a dream, and with the help of Walter Peña, now the manager of the lodge, a plan was developed, much of the old poorly constructed lodge was torn down and the new lodge was built from the ground up.  It was an ominous task that ended up more costly than anticipated and taking longer to finish than planned as so much is centered around the rise and fall of the Amazon River.  But it was worth it and early in 2010 we were ready to present our beautiful new lodge to guests.  The dream was realized!


It is also my dream to do something more, to give back, especially to the local jungle communities, to get involved in a more profound way than just as a tourist lodge. I want to create a place for learning and giving.  We also want to provide our guests an opportunity to visit a magical place, to learn about the Amazon and all that it has to offer; to understand why it is so ecologically important to our world.

 

Our staff have been loyal to us, sticking with us through these lean times.  We want to try to continue to provide a place of employment for them as jobs are difficult to find.


WHAT WE HAVE DONE


We have tried many things to draw attention to our lodge, created a new website:  www.chullachaquiecolodge.com, contacted travel agencies in Peru and in the United States, we have reached out to our friends and family to pass along the word about our lodge and also contacted former guests and asked them to get the word out.  We've  created a facebook page dedicated to the lodge.  We practice sustainable tourism by employing people from the local jungle communities to work in the lodge, we purchase fish and other products from the local communities and hire locals to provide services such as construction, security and more.

We have cut our costs in every way possible, but we cannot survive without bringing in guests.  And we want to survive.


WHAT WE NEED

We realized that you work very hard for your money and you have a choice on where you invest. We hope you will feel the survival of Chullachaqui Lodge is a worthwhile cause and that you will consider participating in our fundraiser.  We are extremely grateful for all contributions, no matter how small or large.  We also understand that not everyone can contribute, but you can still help us by getting the word out about our fundraiser.  All will assist us in our survival.

Our goals are listed in order of importance and how we plan to use any funds that are raised through IndieGoGo.  Funds raised will be used for solely for the goals outlined below.  If we do not reach our financial goal, any funds raised will still be used toward reaching our goals.

·         It is critical to develop a marketing budget in order to develop brochures and other maketing materials, to market our website so it will rise to a more prominent position, to allow us the opportunity to join essential partners like Prom Peru and the local Chamber of Commerce and others that will help us reach out to promote the Lodge.   It is essential for us to market the Lodge in the United States and European market.

·         Our small boat needs a motor.  This boat was stolen and recovered minus the motor and the interior fittings.  To upgrade this little boat and add a motor would help us tremendously to cut down our gasoline costs when there are only a few guests going to the lodge.  We need to purchase a minimum 50 HP motor for this boat.

·         It is important for us to construct new staff quarters.  Our present building was one of the original poorly constructed buildings that we were unable to replace when we were doing the new construction and unfortunately it is built quite low and due to the flooding of the Amazon, the Rio Tapira has risen a little higher each year during the high water season and this building ends up with a foot or so of water inside and we are unable to use it during this time.  Afterward, it requires extensive cleanup and repair.

·         It is extremely important to us to become more involved with the local communities in the education of the children in our local villages and providing assistance in the form of school supplies and transport to Iquitos.  We also want to teach our communities more about ecology and how they can participate in saving the Rain Forest.  We can do this by bringing in experts to help teach them good practices.

·         We also want to become more involved in the ecology of the Rain Forest, partner with non-profit organizations that are established to protect and save the Rain Forest so that we can find ways to do our part to protect Rain Forest.  We would also hope to partner with a University and utilize our lodge as a research center for students and professors and we would eventually like to build a research lab for this purpose.

·         Our water system needs to be redone, with new water tanks and a good filtration system.  We utilize a well and because it was not originally installed deep enough, and filtration is not good enough we have a lot of minerals in the water that clog the shower heads and discolor our sinks, toilets and showers.

·         We want to make many improvements to the lodge, such as bring in solar power to provide electricity in our kitchen and provide hot water,  We want to remain rustic and do not plan to have electric lights, but we would like to be able to provide electric to charge batteries, phones, laptops, etc, for our guests.   We would also like to have a satellite phone in the lodge to give us better access to the outside world in case of any type of an emergency.  Other amenities that we would like to add at some point for the comfort of our guests, are ceiling fans in our sleeping rooms and WiFi.

·         We feel it is important to become a certified lodge for sustainable tourism. We adhere to Eco friendly practices, but we want to do more.  We want to work with Rainforest Alliance to become certified through their training and technical assistance.  Once we have completed training we would want to be verified (which means that someone would have to be sent to the lodge to review and certify us and we would have to pay for costs associated with this process, including airfare, etc.).

 

As you can see we have dreams and lots of things to accomplish!  We may not be able to do all of these things immediately, but we want to do as much as we can.  We are asking you to help us realize our dreams and we will be forever grateful for your help.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

 

Please, get the word out to your friends, post our cause on your Facebook page, blog about us, twitter about us.  Use your social media to get the word out about us.  We realize the not everyone will be able to make a contribution, but you can help us by getting the word out about our fundraiser!
story_txt:
ABOUT
CHULLACHAQUI LODGE
The
mighty Amazon River flows past mythical forests and the
reflection of the deep greens of the jungle and wide blue skies on the river’s dark
water create a special magic. Here, biological diversity is at its riches, Pink
Dolphins rule the river and lily pads grow as big as small pools. Sloth
and Iguana are common jungle creatures, and the jewel-like colors of the bird
life are stunning.
Our lodge
is constructed primarily with local eco friendly materials, built in the
traditional way, and we choose to use local labor from our surrounding
communities. Our guests find the best of both
worlds: comfort and great service and an opportunity to
experience all that the Amazon has to offer!
 Eco-cultural
activities are organized to promote sustainable tourism. Our local
bilingual naturalist guides host excursions including: daily hikes in the
jungle, birding, nocturnal activities, paddling dugout canoes, piranha fishing,
tours to spot exotic animals including: sloths, caiman, pink and gray river
dolphins, reptiles, amphibians, insects, all sorts of monkeys, birds and, of
course, the flora including gorgeous flowers, impressive giant trees and the
important medicinal plants of the rain forest.  We also visit nearby
jungle communities, where we do many cooperative activities, this gives
our guests an opportunity to personally met the native people and learn about
their culture.

OUR CHALLENGES
Because of the economy, tourism in Iquitos is way down.  Gasoline prices are up, as are the costs of
food, and upkeep of the lodge.  The lodge must be maintained at all times,
as the jungle takes it back very quickly.  Our lodge is located 97 kilometers (60 miles) up the Amazon River from
Iquitos, Peru.  This presents a challenge as the only way to reach the
lodge is by our speed boat and it is very costly to operate our boat when we
only have a few guests.  Our location is an ideal spot in primary rain
forest in which to enjoy the Amazon River, the Rain Forest, its flora, fauna and
its people.  We have to maintain minimum staff in the lodge at all times
and we have to maintain a small office in Iquitos from which we operate.  We
are in our second year of operation under the new ownership and we want
to survive.  But it is becoming more difficult to keep the lodge open.  Most of our guests are referrals from former guests, or they find us when they arrive in Iquitos looking for the perfect lodge with the programs they want.

WHY THIS
FUNDRAISER IS IMPORTANT TO ME! 
I turned my world upside down by
using my retirement to purchase the lodge.  It is difficult for family and
friends to understand why it is so important to me, but it is the epitome of my
love of Peru and the Amazon Rain Forest.  It gives me a unique purpose
that I have never before had.   When I purchased this lodge, I had a
dream, and with the help of Walter Peña, now the manager of the lodge, a plan
was developed, much of the old poorly constructed lodge was torn down and the
new lodge was built from the ground up.  It was an ominous task that ended
up more costly than anticipated and taking longer to finish than planned as so
much is centered around the rise and fall of the Amazon River.  But it was
worth it and early in 2010 we were ready to present our beautiful new lodge to
guests.  The dream was realized!

It is also my dream to do something more, to give back, especially to the local jungle communities, to get involved in a more profound way than just as a tourist lodge. I want to create a place for learning and giving.  We also want to provide our guests an opportunity to visit a magical place, to learn about the Amazon and all that it has to offer; to understand why it is so ecologically important to our world.
 
Our staff have been loyal to us, sticking with us through these lean times.  We want to try to continue to provide a place of employment for them as jobs are difficult to find.

WHAT WE HAVE DONE

We have tried many things to draw
attention to our lodge, created a new website:  www.chullachaquiecolodge.com,
contacted travel agencies in Peru and in the United States, we have reached out
to our friends and family to pass along the word about our lodge and also contacted
former guests and asked them to get the word out.  We've  created
a facebook page dedicated to the lodge.  We practice sustainable tourism
by employing people from the local jungle communities to work in the lodge, we
purchase fish and other products from the local communities and hire locals
to provide services such as construction, security and more.
We have
cut our costs in every way possible, but we cannot survive without
bringing in guests.  And we want to survive.

WHAT WE NEED
We realized
that you work very hard for your money and you have a choice on where you invest. We
hope you will feel the survival of Chullachaqui Lodge is a worthwhile cause and that you will consider participating in our fundraiser.  We
are extremely grateful for all contributions, no matter how small or large.  We also
understand that not everyone can contribute, but you can still help us by
getting the word out about our fundraiser.  All will
assist us in our survival.
Our goals are listed in order of importance and how
we plan to use any funds that are raised through IndieGoGo.  Funds raised
will be used for solely for the goals outlined below.  If we do not
reach our financial goal, any funds raised will still be used toward reaching
our goals.
·         It is critical to develop a marketing budget in order to develop brochures and other maketing materials, to market our
website so it will rise to a more prominent position, to allow us the opportunity to join
essential partners like Prom Peru and the local Chamber of Commerce and others
that will help us reach out to promote the Lodge.   It is essential
for us to market the Lodge in the United States and European market.
·        
Our small boat needs a motor.  This
boat was stolen and recovered minus the motor and the interior fittings.
 To upgrade this little boat and add a motor would help us tremendously to
cut down our gasoline costs when there are only a few guests going to the
lodge.  We need to purchase a minimum 50 HP motor for this boat.
·        
It is important for us to construct new
staff quarters.  Our present building was one of the original poorly
constructed buildings that we were unable to replace when we were doing the new
construction and unfortunately it is built quite low and due to
the flooding of the Amazon, the Rio Tapira has risen a little higher
each year during the high water season and this building ends up
with a foot or so of water inside and we are unable to use it during
this time.  Afterward, it requires extensive cleanup and repair.
·        
It is extremely important to us to
become more involved with the local communities in the education of the
children in our local villages and providing assistance in the form of school
supplies and transport to Iquitos.  We also want to teach our communities more about ecology and
how they can participate in saving the Rain Forest.  We can do this by
bringing in experts to help teach them good practices.
·        
We also want to become more involved in
the ecology of the Rain Forest, partner with non-profit organizations that are
established to protect and save the Rain Forest so that we can find
ways to do our part to protect Rain Forest.  We would also hope to partner
with a University and utilize our lodge as a research center for students and

·         Our water system needs to be redone, with new water tanks and a good filtration system.  We utilize a well and because it was not originally installed deep enough, and filtration is not good enough we have a lot of minerals in the water that clog the shower heads and discolor our sinks, toilets and showers.

As you can
see we have dreams and lots of things to accomplish!  We
may not be able to do all of these things immediately, but we want to do as
much as we can.  We are asking you to help
us realize our dreams and we will be forever grateful for your help.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
 
Please, get the word out to your friends, post our cause on
your Facebook page, blog about us, twitter about us.  Use your social
media to get the word out about us.  We realize the not everyone will be
able to make a contribution, but you can help us by getting the word out about
our fundraiser!

story:
Short Summary

I'm a passionate visual artist, photographer, filmmaker, painter, all-style & roller-skate dancer & automobile aficionado. Life goal is to finish my documentary film, "The Bboy Connection," I enjoy experiencing new adventures. 

This project is very important to me because this is a chance and a life time opportunity to have a unlimited gas card to go where ever I want to go and do what I enjoy by taking photos of great landscapes and exploring our nation.  

I would appreciate this opportunity very much so I can also drive to New York and other east coast locations to finishing important interviews of the characters in my bboy documentary that are a part of American history. The world needs to learn and understand their story and how this dance the bboy "Breakdance" came from. It is a timeline history and this trip will be a small step closer to reaching my goal. 

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Between $1500 to $2000 will help me stay on the road and capture the photos that I enjoy to photograph and film on video. That way I wont have to rush home to take care of business and focus more on what I enjoy the most, photography/filmmaking and travel. If I make more than this then the longer I can stay in each city and especially in New York where I need to spend the most time for my documentary film. Money also for survival, blessing the people I know that will let me stay with in New York. It is not easy getting some of the dancers to do interviews with me. When I offer them some money to help them out and take them out to eat during the interviews really helps. Hotels on other routes along the way and also to visit my family on the east cost. All my family from my mothers side is on the east coast. Their in North Carolina, Kentucky, DC and Brooklyn New York. To catch up with my family and take portraits of many cousins, aunts and uncles who I haven't seen since I was a kid living in the east coast and the cousins I haven't met who are only friends on my facebook. To finally get many of my photos printed on large prints and canvas to give to the people who donate to the perk they choose and o prepare for future galleries of my art to then try it again for the final fundraiser for my bboy connection documentary film "The Bboy Connection." 

By choosing the perks below will give you exclusive insights to my work. Prints that only you will have from limited editions that you choose from. by choosing the screenings you will see never before footage of bboy dance history that has never been posted online. Interviews and stories you will see that will have you educating your mind with a whole new look and understanding of the history of the "bboy" dance culture and hip-hop's timeline from the last 40 years of it's existence. 

Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

If I don't reach my entire goal then I will have a shorter drive and only drive to places that were already planned for Space camp. Remember my trip to Space Camp is already paid for by Ford Motors including my gas. My hotel is already paid for once I get to Space camp. I will just be driving straight back home if if I don't reach my goal or even with half or 30% of my goal I will drive a little extra to new cities based on the support and budget from this campaign. 

The Impact

With your contributions I will make me a very happy person on the road giving peace signs to every driver passing me by. You will be a part of hip hop history in the credits of the film if you you choose that perk. You will be happy with amazing photos hanging on your wall or your computer desk. Your guest will always smile and will be inspired to want to travel. I hope that my photos will inspire you to want to travel and see the world. Inspire kids to be behind a camera instead of playing a video game all day. Inspire people to be out doors and enjoy nature. 

Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).

You can visit my website and see some of the work I have done in the past.

I was one of the first 6 people in the USA to test out the first prosumer HD cameras in 2004 for Sony Broadcast. They had me do demonstrations of my footage at the DV Expos, NAB shows in Las Vegas and the digital center at the Sundance film festival. 

I have worked on two other documentaries for Too Short and RMM Media based on Big Freedia.
www.mooncricketfilms.com

I have a successful unplanned music video I shot for Goapele "Closer" the original that you can view on youtube or my website. 

I was one of the first people to stream live with a mobile device in 2007 by Justin of justin.tv as their beta tester before it went public way before the google glass. I had taken it to another level by streaming my life like the movie "Your Truman Show" and traveling the country and going on dates while streaming live. 
www.justin.tv/mooncricket

Ford Motors found me on justin.tv in 2009 and saw that I was doing something different and needed a car. That is when I was chosen as a fiesta movement agent to drive for 8 months with free gas card. This is now my 3rd year on the fiesta movement campaign. I won an award from Ford Motors in 2009 for best content and photography from my cross country travels. 2010 I won 3rd pace a new professional camera. Now I'm back to travel again on my fiesta movement adventures. www.fiestamovement.com

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not every one can support with money but there are other ways to support. By sharing the this indiegogo link. Make sure when sharing that they include this link. i have it on my youtube link info as well just in case.

story: • Trying to raise funds for a trip to miami
story_txt: Trying to raise funds for a trip to miami

story:
Who I Am

My journey began on December 17th, 2008, when I survived a fire that consumed my house and the majority of my worldly possessions. After spending Christmas with friends and family, the insurance claim was settled and I was presented with an incredible opportunity and a very difficult choice. Life had given me a “do-over” and this time I was going to invest in things that couldn’t go up in smoke. I chose to seek out experience and adventure; I chose to travel.

After collecting my insurance claim, I embarked on a multi-month road trip adventure around the US that forever changed who I am. Living day-to-day, focusing on my most basic needs, I quickly realized that traveling can be so much more than seeing the sights. Once given the ability to choose my own path, I felt the freedom and security of being a completely self-contained unit. Though traveling has given me some of the most valuable lessons of my life, it all comes at a price.

Once my insurance settlement ran out and I returned to Virginia, I felt restless and couldn’t wait to get back some of that freedom I had become so fond of while traveling. Empowered with a new sense of self-reliance, I moved to Portland, OR in the summer of 2011. My new home would introduce me to more freedom and security than I had ever thought possible. 

Portland introduced me to a vibrant and supportive bike culture where I found lots of that freedom I had been craving since my first road-trip adventure. My passion for cycling grew until my next obvious step was a long distance tour.

In the summer of 2013 I was finally able to combine my love for travel and my love for cycling in a 1,111 mile ride along the California coast. Cycling gave me the opportunity to travel on a limited budget and to learn how much more rewarding traveling can be by bike rather than by car. In the coming months, I will embark on another grand cycling adventure and with your help, I’d like to share that experience with the world.

The Tour and Blog

This July, my mom's side of the family will be gathering in her hometown of Battle Creek, Michigan. Starting from my driveway in Portland, I'll ride the 3,000+ miles to meet them! I want to share this mission of freedom, adventure, and advocacy. To do this I'm creating a content rich, professional website and blog. I’ll share my experience in real time with regular blog posts, maps, video journals and travel tips. I want to bring you along for the ride. Although travel can often seem out of reach for those on a tight budget, I’ll show you how cycling can make it accessible to almost anyone. I’ll be using lots of money saving techniques along the entire route. I’ll share my secrets for finding the best free camp sites, show you how to build some of your own gear and even share some of my recipes for high calorie meals you can make on the road.

What I Need

My base goal of $2000 will enable me to create engaging content while on the road and share it with you via my blog. This amount includes a $700 budget for web design, hosting and maintenance. The largest cost associated with this will be for daily website maintenance while I'm on the road. Because of my limited internet access, I'll need someone to edit videos and blog posts as well as manage the website while I'm traveling. I've estimated an $800 budget for recording and other electronic equipment and a $500 budget for supplies for DIY projects. I've designed this project to scale with available funds, so as funds vary, the scope of these projects can expand or shrink to match.

story:
Here's my standard artist bio that I use to introduce myself:

Patrice Helmar is an Alaskan artist, photographer, and educator. Helmar's photography is inspired, in part, by her desire to honor and continue the craft of her father. Helmar's work is influenced by documentary and street photography, as well as by modern painting and literature. Patrice most recently had a solo exhibition the summer of 2011, at the Juneau Douglas City Museum. Her work has appeared in solo, and group shows in Alaska.

Patrice was the 2012 featured artist in the University of Alaska literary magazine, "Tidal Echoes". In addition to her artwork being featured in the publication, she juried the fall student artwork show at UAS. 


You probably already know me, and if we've hung out in the past few months - you've heard about how excited I am to be going to a photography workshop with Mary Ellen Mark in Reykjavik, Iceland. 

This two week workshop with Mary Ellen Mark and her husband, Martin Bell is an incredible oppotunity for me to create a body of photographic work with the guidance of one of the world's great documentary photographers. 

Please follow my journey on my blog, An Alaskan in Iceland. 

Here's the deal . . .

The workshop will take place this summer, from June 22-August 9, and I'm asking for your help to get me there & back again! I know it's coming up this weekend, but I get nervous about these fundraiser deals. 

The workshop is expensive. It costs around $3,800, and travel to and from Alaska is never cheap. I'm not asking for my entire trip to be funded, but I'm setting a goal of $5,000 and any little bit you might be able to give can help.

This money will help me off set the cost of the workshop, publish a small book of a body of my work, and allow me to create/print some thank you gifts for contributors. 

Here's a taste of what I'll be doing in Iceland . . .

1. Create a body of photographic work in a vibrant city alive with music festivals, a gay pride parade, fisherman, people on the street, musicians, people like me and you, anything that captures my eye. 

2. Meet with Mary Ellen Mark each morning for an individual critique and session covering the photographic work from my previous day. 

3. Attend lectures, discussions, and exhibitions as a part of the workshop group. Additionally, I will be staying in an apartment with three other workshop attendees dedicated to photography and filmmaking, who will support a positive peer learning community. 

4. Create a body of work for submission to print publications, for an Alaska State Museum exhibition, gallery exhibition, or even possibly for admission into a graduate program in photography.

5. Create my own book with my images from Iceland, and a body of my work from the past ten years. 

You can help! 

The Impact: 

As an artist who is also an educator, I'll be coming back to Juneau and bringing my knowledge into the classroom and my community. I believe in experiential learning. By learning from and photographing other cultures, I can enrich the culture I am a part of. 

Are you a public school teacher in Juneau, Alaska getting ready for the 2012 - 2013 school year? If I'm not hired by the Juneau school district as a full time teacher, I'd be happy to give a lesson on writing about photography, or art as it fits into your curriculum. 

If I am hired on as a teacher in the Juneau School District, yay!  I'll have my own classroom where I'll integrate my experience and work in Iceland into my own lessons, and will be happy to talk to other educators about art education in language arts or social studies classrooms. 

I'll have a new body of work - and this is huge for me. I'll be able to apply for shows around the state, and if I feel confident enough at the Alaska State Museum during the next call for submissions. 

If you're having a rough time financially, (most of us are) but you believe this project is worthy of having other folks take a look - pass it on. 

Link my site to your facebook account, post it to your Tumblr, tweet it up, or email it to friends you think may be able to support my project in Iceland. 

I appreciate your time and consideration.
story_txt:
Here's my standard artist bio that I use to introduce myself:
Patrice Helmar is an Alaskan artist, photographer, and educator. Helmar's photography is inspired, in part, by her desire to honor and continue the craft of her father. Helmar's work is influenced by documentary and street photography, as well as by modern painting and literature. Patrice most recently had a solo exhibition the summer of 2011, at the Juneau Douglas City Museum. Her work has appeared in solo, and group shows in Alaska.
Patrice was the 2012 featured artist in the  University of Alaska literary magazine, "Tidal Echoes". In addition to her artwork being featured in the publication, she juried the fall student artwork show at UAS. 
You probably already know me, and if we've hung out in the past few months - you've heard about how excited I am to be going to a photography workshop with Mary Ellen Mark in Reykjavik, Iceland. 
This two week workshop with Mary Ellen Mark and her husband, Martin Bell is an incredible oppotunity for me to create a body of photographic work with the guidance of one of the world's great documentary photographers.

story:
Why IC Cheer?

With only a month left until Daytona 2015, IC Cheer is working extremely hard to make their dreams of finals come true. But they need your help to get there!!

Ithaca College's competitive cheerleading team has placed in the top two places at Reach the Beach Nationals since 2011. Last year, IC Cheer made history as they traveled to Daytona Beach, Florida to compete at NCA Nationals for the very first time. The 2014-15 season has brought IC Cheer 20 cheerleaders and a whole lot of talent - that's why we need your help to make our dreams come true. We'd like to travel back to NCA Nationals for the second time to compete at finals, and we can't do it without your help.

What We Need & What You Get

Your donation of any amount will go towards the following:

· Competition registration fees

· Hotel rooms while traveling

· Flights

The Impact

If you donate to IC Cheer, we promise to work our very hardest to prove to you that we are the BEST we can be. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please consider sharing this link on your Facebook or Twitter profile - the more people who know about this campaign, the more people will hopefully help us towards our goals.

If you don't want to pay by credit card, please e-mail mpetri1@ithaca.edu and McKenna will help you send cash or a check to help the team reach their goals.

story:
==================

UPDATE!  We completed our test flights in Leon, Mexico!  Success!

We test-flew the little yellow boat, under helium balloons, to over 20,000 feet-- in manned flight! We even tested landing on a lake, to test the viability of landing on water-- if we need to ditch at sea. Check out our flying boat!  This is the trans-Atlantic shakeout flight!

For the next test, I built and flew a massive cluster of balloons-- like we will need for the Atlantic Ocean;  I used that cluster to fly a house!  We had partnership to pay for the helium, and this allowed us to test building a massive cluster-- which serves as a proof-of-concept that we can actually build a cluster of balloons large enough for our trans-Atlantic dreams!

Video here;

Great pics in the Telegraph!

==================

 

I want to take a huge cluster of toy helium balloons, tie them to my tiny yellow boat, and fly across the Atlantic Ocean.

This childhood dream is an achievable reality. I can totally do this.

Didn’t you have a dream like this?  As a child, didn’t you wonder if it could be done?

Years have been spent to get to this point, and we are an the brink of making history.  I am an experienced pilot and I've flown cluster balloons many times.

I've conquered the English Channel, departing England, floating out over the iconic White Cliffs of Dover, and landing in the welcoming fields of France. 

On a bitter cold night, many months later, I launched in France, crossed the Alps, and landed in the deep green fields of Italy the next morning.

If you open the 2012 Guinness Book of World Records, you will see me on the first full page, flying away in manned flight under the largest cluster of balloons ever built.  Well, the largest built so far…

Because there she is, looming in front of us: The Atlantic Ocean.  Nobody has made an attempt like this, and together, you and I might just ride the winds across the skies, and across the seas, to wonderful success.

What We Need 

Can you imagine the number of balloons it takes? Even to get off the ground I need a massive cluster. But to be successful in this journey together we will need to build the largest cluster of balloons ever flown — eclipsing the current world record we set previously. We will need to fly longer than anyone has ever flown like this. 

I will need wind. I will need helium. I will need hope. 

To succeed, I need that precious, invisible gas: helium. I need 106,215 cubic feet of helium. That is the exact amount needed for this Indiegogo project.  It is sold by Praxair, an industrial gas provider. It is invisible, yet vital.

There will be a television documentary made. If you cause this flight to happen, you will see what you have created. In news reports during the crossing, in the documentary that is to follow, you will know what you helped to make happen: dreams, inspiration, and genuine adventure for millions of people, even in our modern times.

The Impact

The stunning imagery produced during our expeditions takes people back to their childhood dreams. It is inspoirational.  It is beuatiful. And it is unique.

The seemingly impossible is up for grabs. If we can throw ourselves into this great challenge and succeed, it reminds all of us what we can achieve as individuals, and as a team.

The project is real, and well documented.  Our previous adventures were news sensations; covered live on TV, online and in newspapers around the world.  

Other Ways You Can Help

I'm here, on the coast of Maine, in the USA-- staring at the sea, staring at the sand, and dreaming of what we can do, while working towards the goal.  In addition to the helium, I need a launch site in Presque Isle or Caribou, Maine:  A grassy field where I can stage the helium.  Reach out if you might like to host the launch.

I need helium.  And I need you.  This is not a solitary event.  I need so many people to come out in the dead of night and inflate balloons, when the moment comes.  I need you to follow the flight as it unfolds—I will have a tracker that will show my progress on the website, as I fly.  I need you to root for me, as you see the progress in the press.  I need you to catch me from the sky when I make it across the ocean to any dry land on the far side of the sea.

If we can just get enough balloons, helium and hope, we can do something truly incredible.

story: CHIP was formed to assist long-term hospital patients, especially those fighting catastrophic illnesses, stay in touch with family and friends when their own funds have been depleted. Their primary goal is to enable those least able to afford such services a chance to stay connected to the outside world through phone, internet, long distance cards, and TV. Hospital life can be daunting, especially while battling a life-threatening illness and communication with the ones we love is critical in this time of need. Two of my friends suffered isolated hospital stays. Margo Ford battled cancer in a Toronto Hospital during the SARS epidemic, and Phyllis Pitre spent much of her childhood in a Halifax hospital. Jim and I are zooming through the streets of Niagara Falls on Sunday, October 21st, to raise funds and awareness for CHIP Charity (www.chipcharity.com). Your support is greatly appreciated. Please donate a dollar or two. Every dollar helps.
story_txt:

Please donate a dollar or two.  Every dollar helps.

story: As you are all very aware of, Alana lives in Michigan now and can't afford to come home as often as we would like (AKA every weekend). If we all "buy" Alana a birthday present by donating some money, we can get her home before thanksgiving! All donations perks will be hand-made by Alana and Anya.

story:
Featured In...

                 

Short Summary

Hello! We are a start-up from Finland and we have designed a simple travel product that really works. The Relax ALLY Travel Restband allows you to finally get cozy while traveling in a seated position!!

Our dream is to share the Relax ALLY story with travellers all over the world. Please support us to take our Indiegogo mission to the final destination and do some environmental good while doing so.

And remember, sharing is caring so please let the fellow travellers know:
Share on Facebook
Share on Twitter


The Problem

Trying to sleep while traveling in a seated position can cause the head to nod off or "surf".  This leads to waking up abruptly, poor sleep, awkward situations and potential micro-trauma to the neck and shoulder muscles. 

 

Nodding off

 

Awkward situation 

 Muscular stress

 

Relax ALLY  ...saves your trip!

Relax ALLY ® Restband™ fastens the head firmly to the seat and by doing so prevents the head from nodding off and thus sleep from being interrupted. Furthermore the ergonomic position helps to fall asleep and allows the muscles to relax. With Relax ALLY, you can save your neck and shoulders from soreness.

 

Relax in an Ergonomic position

 

Usage

The Relax ALLY ® Restband™ is fast and easy to use:

Steps:

  1. Fasten the Restband Srap to the seat. Adjust the Restband according to your head size and attach it to the strap.
  2. Place the Restband over your head and adjust to the best position by moving your head inside the Restband.
  3. Relax your muscles and let yourself to fall into a relaxed sleep.

Different methods of attaching the strap to the seat:

Where

The Relax ALLY ® Restband™ can be used as a passenger in all forms of transportation; cars, busses, trains and aeroplanes...

 

...or wherever there is a head level reaching seat-back.

 

Packaging contents:

Relax ALLY ® Restband™ consists of the band, fastening strap and a cool carry bag

Relax ALLY Restbands, two to choose from (BLACK with blue and RED with black)

 Relax ALLY Restbands

 

 

Relax ALLY® Restband™

Safety

Relax ALLY ® Restband™ is safe; it is attached with a snap button that detaches with a gentle pull when needed to.

The Restband is made of safe, non-allergic, and recyclable materials.

Testimonial from Dr. Harvey Eckhart   Santa Rosa, California

 

Ergonomic Evaluation by Dr. Harvey Eckhart


Our Mission

We believe that travel time can be spent more relaxed when needed to. Our mission is to get this product available to the travelers around the world. To backpackers, businessmen & women and holiday lovers.

And while doing so, to take the responsibility and help you to do some good along the way. Traveling wont stop any time soon, but we can help to minimize the bad environmental effects, and jointly fight the carbon dioxide emissions related to travel (see community for details).

Perks

The company is based in Finland, and unfortunately at the moment it is against our Finnish law or at least in the grey area to raise money through crowdfunding without giving a clear product in return, so we are limited in perks that we can offer to you to support us, sorry for that! Therefore please only use the defined perks (You will receive a product in return).

Hopefully you can still find the option that suites you best to support us. In the sad event that you don't find a perk, but you still believe in the cause and want to support us in our mission you can do so by joining the Relaxed traveller community at facebook: http://www.facebook.com/relaxALLY

...and share the good news:

Share on Facebook
Share on Twitter

Community

Facebook Relaxed travellers community. By joining you attest that you will use your time more wisely and proudly Relax while travelling.

As a member you will be participating in doing good as we will donate 10 cents per each Restband sold -per a facebook joined community member- to clean energy projects (E.g. 20000 Restband sold and 1800 community members would eq in 1800x10cents). With just a 1% of the estimated of 1,3B international flight travelers (year 2013) alone this could be already a huge number... The annual donation target will be influenced, and ultimately decided by the community.

The Relaxed travellers facebook community will receive the best and exclusive offers and heads-ups for our products and our future travel partner agencies. We are giving you the possibility to influence the journey, and future development of our products, and the community.

We believe in the power of people. Let us do the scale up with the masses and get the best offers to you while you just sit back, do good and Relax!

So support by joining already today even if you are planning to get the Restband later: www.facebook.com/relaxALLY

 

History and crowdfunding

Relax ALLY ® Restband™ is a new Finnish innovation designed and developed by our team in collaboration with Aalto University Design Factory & Protomo labs.

We have been working with this project over a year. Countless prototypes and lessons have been learned. We believe we are now ready to take it to the market, but the biggest and the most expensive production and marketing steps are still ahead. This is were the raised money will be directed to.

The product has been presented to selected audience at TFWA World Exhibition and we have received 15 invitation for tenders from airline companies (some of the biggest Europeans included). In addition we are also showcasing our products in the MATKA2013 biggest EU Nordic Travel Fair in Helsinki on 17-20th of January.

Crowdfunding is a great vehicle for allowing us to start the Relax ALLY international sales, spreading the awareness and gaining the capital and publicity needed to make our Restband available to every traveler.

By supporting you will be the first to receive our production pieces and join the relaxed travelers community.

Shortly after this crowdfunding project is successfully funded we will be able to start selling globally through the website and (hopefully) in the retail stores, airplanes and more!

Heads-up Travellers! Let's make our travels cozier together.

story:
Short Summary

A simple prayer during a 21-Day fast ignited this couple to face the challenges that were NEEDED to be overcome in order to gain the wisdom NEEDED before saying "I Do". Having the same desires and wanting the best for each other made this an emotional process but a very enlightening and fulfilling one.

~ "We were told with such a tight budget, that we would not be able to have our dream wedding and needed to loosen the purse strings. With a positive, creative mindset, the use of our own funds, donated time and a few coupons we accomplished what we were told could not happen."

~ "Since family is very important to us both, we were not certain that Kelly's mom and some of Juanita's family would be able to make it. Kelly's mom has been very sick, but with a lot of prayer and positive works, things were put into motion that allowed her and other family to witness our union with great joy!"

"After seeing the unbelievable appear before our eyes on March 23rd, we were excited and looking forward to a peaceful and much needed honeymoon the next day. Working hard and serving others is our life, so when we arrived early to the airport with our boarding passes in hand, we just knew Day 1 of our lives would be another happy occasion, but instead it was Day 1 of facing our first challenge together as a married couple.

While dropping our car rental off early Sunday morning at the Budget location, we were faced by a disgruntle employee who slowly changed our glowing faces to that of confusion. He spoke to us with anger and disrespect. As time went by, it seemed that we would never leave with a solution to his argument concerning the already full gas tank. Juanita mentioned that we had to catch a flight and instantly the employee flipped and became quite belligerent. She apologized but we were cut off and sent to his supervisor. After more time was wasted, the employees still talked to us in circles and did not come up with an answer. They were then reminded again that we had to leave to go on our honeymoon.

Arriving to the gate with everyone gone and every seat deserted was one of the most emptying feelings. We stayed for 3 hours to get help from American Airlines, Carnival Cruises and our travel agent so we could know all of our options, but were told at that time that we had none. We even were on stand-by for the next flight, but only one seat was available. We decided not to separate.

The days that followed were spent talking to all of these variables to understand what we could do and if we could be reimbursed, finally the answers respectfully were NOTHING and NO."

What We Need & What You Get

"This circumstance opened our eyes again to the fact that not everyone is on our side, BUT we still believe that there are people out there that ARE on our side and willing to help us celebrate our happiness since we missed this opportunity.

If you can find it in your hearts to give please do.

  • We lost much more, but believe raising at least $1,000 is a fantastic start
  • Depending on how much we raise on this site and save on our own will determine exactly where we will go for our honeymoon - suggestions are accepted.
  • Please share our story with others including the use of the Indiegogo share tools.

Again thank you for your contributions!

story:
When travelling, you always feel troubled by messy personal belongings and bags of various kinds. Now you can rule them all with Livek large-storage yet lightweight organizing bag. The minimalist Nordic-style makes the bag a chic accessory to your luggage and it only makes your travelling partners jealous because Livek makes travelling so easy yet so chic. What really kills it is that Livek organizing bag is endurable , water-proof and bacteria-resistant. Your travelling partners will worship your Livek organizing bag.

Travelling is already tiresome enough. So we designed Livek organizing bags in a black and white mosaic pattern with smart storage concepts that make compact pouches and bags go a long way. Livek is here to avoid any luggage troubles and to simplify your travelling experience.

The thought of all kinds of items lumped together in a crowded bag would just drive every traveler crazy. Livek is here to put you out of that misery by setting up reasonable compartments for each bag and give home to items of the same kind so they can live together harmoniously. You will never ever find out that your shampoo is placed in a pile of shirts or your dirty socks get mixed with your clean pants.

Livek is very considerate because it has different bags for different trips. Whether for long journey, business trip, outing or routine visit to the gym, Livek covers it all.

  • Made with DuPont™Tyvek ®, a high-density polyethylene flash spunbond non-woven special fabric – being super light, with low flammability, almost impossible to tear, and both bacteria-proof and dirt-resistant.
  • Waterproof and breathable PU (Polyurethane) Coating – perfectly withstanding high levels of wear-and-tear, with an increased durability and a high resistance to stains.
  • The safe and eco-friendly materials used in the highly challenging environments of the medical and construction industries is used in Livek Travel Packing Organizers to offer you an incredible comfort and efficiency.

DuPont™ Tyvek® Strength and Barrier Demonstration

DuPont™ Tyvek® Breathability Demonstration

Upgrade your travel with Livek, a brand of luxury travel organization bags perfect for the frequent ﬂyer who wants to travel smart, the regular gym-goer making a style statement in the changing rooms, or those wanting to keep their grooming, cosmetic or clothes and organized at home or on the go. 

Our passion is to give you a chic, practical and elegant alternative to the often drab toilet pouch and laundry bag. Each bag features Nordic minimalism, streamlined black and white detailing with bright mosaic elements, making them more of a work of art than a travel or organizational accessory. 

Be it a business trip, pleasurable holiday or a gym visit, no matter the climate or occasion, when you need a stylish travel organization bag, Livek should be the one destination on your mind.

At the end of the day, Livek is about living life in a better and smarter way, so we have the perfect bag to make your life as smooth and comfortable as you want it to be.

story:
AirBuddy is the smallest and lightest diving gear in the world. Designed specifically for self-guided shallow water dives, it brings more freedom to diving - no air refills, rentals, complicated logistics or bulky gear! With AirBuddy's tankless design, you choose your locations and can dive anytime and anywhere. And it fits in your bag, making it a perfect companion for your travels.

Get closer to underwater life than when snorkeling and experience the weightless feeling without carrying heavy air-filled tanks on your back.

Diving & being spontaneous? Definitely YES! Pack your AirBuddy for a family day on a beach, go yachting or drive up the coast in your campervan. Or just use if for any other diving activities in shallow water such as underwater photography, lobstering, coral gardening, hull cleaning, pool maintenance, etc.

 

We have been featured in the following media outlets and events. If you are interested in writing about AirBuddy, please feel free to check out our press kit and get in touch with us at media@airbuddy.net.

AirBuddy brings a new alternative, bridging the gap between snorkeling and SCUBA. The rechargeable battery-powered air compressor provides you with fresh air from the surface. Just grab it and go swimming between corals and fish - for up to 45 minutes and max 12 metres (40ft) deep. Easy as that!

Experience a less inhibited diving experience with increased safety. Don’t carry unnecessarily heavy equipment on yourself - feel like a fish in the water.

  • No heavy gear on your back
  • No need to adjust your buoyancy throughout the dive
  • With no BCD (containing residual air), wear less weights (less gear to carry)
  • With lower drag, wear smaller fins to propel yourself (less gear to carry)
  • Use a more natural frog kick (as opposed to flutter kick)
  • Simply walk to dive sites with difficult road access
  • Set-up and pack-up in less than 2 minutes

We created AirBuddy as a way to give you the freedom to dive whenever you like without the hassle or the restrictive bulk of SCUBA gear. Take AirBuddy with you when the weather is nice (and ocean calm) and you feel like having an amazing day full of new adventures underwater.

 

It's simple. The rechargeable 12V battery powers the air compressor that pressurises the surface air. The air is then delivered to the diver through a receiver and a supply hose with a regulator (mouthpiece). This means you don’t have to store and take all the compressed air with you under water. You breathe fresh air from the surface.

AirBuddy is the ultimate "grab-and-go" solution for recreational diving. It's compact and the entire system weighs only 9.5kg (21 lbs), which is about 60-70% less than other dive gear on the market. You can take it with you literally anywhere - it’s plane-friendly and fits your travel bag. No need to worry about operating it - you can set it up/pack it up in just about 2 minutes.

 

Whether you head to the beach after work, fly on holiday to Fiji, set the sails to cruise, collect abalone, or just want to clean your hull, AirBuddy is the perfect companion for your shallow water diving.

 

AirBuddy sparked interest in many divers who have been supporting us in the last years - performing beta tests, providing ideas and feedback and helping to spread the word about AirBuddy. Here is what some of them say:

 

Fun fact: Did you know that corals tend to grow at relatively shallow depths where the sunlight still penetrates the water? That’s where you also find the majority of marine species that live off of the coral or seek protection in coral structures.

That's why how much you see doesn’t depend on how deep, but how often you dive. Most of our best sightings occurred in depths of less than 12 metres.  Hence the dive depth we designed AirBuddy for. Voilà!!! (We shot all of these photos within this depth. See more on our Instagram).

 

Share the fun & dive together with a buddy. You can either connect 2 divers to one AirBuddy (and get a 45min session, max depth 6m /20ft) or link 2 AirBuddies together (and get 45min session, max depth 12m /40ft). Two AirBuddies will float together in a formation that prevents a potential entanglement of the hoses. And even if the hoses cross one day, no worries - it doesn't stop the air flow.

 

Making you safe is our first priority! With AirBuddy, you dive deep enough to explore the beauty of marine life, but not deep enough to run a serious risk of DCS (decompression sickness, aka "bends"). 

Unless you dive more than 3 times in a row, which is unlikely as you'd need to swap 4 batteries, you still are within the NDL (no decompression limit), thus can surface in case of an emergency without any stops and risk of DCS.

With shallow water diving, you are just seconds away from the surface. You can swim up if needed. An ascent from a shallow dive takes only about 20 sec from 6m/ 20ft to 40sec from 12m/ 40ft at the PADI recommended ascent rates.

In an unlikely event of an emergency, you can use 2 backup systems before needing to perform CESA (controlled emergency swimming ascent):

  • Backup #1: Use 15L compressed emergency air contained in the red float/reservoir, which provides about 4-5 breaths at 12m depth to about 12-15 breaths when closer to surface at about 1m depth.
  • Backup #2: Use 100% redundant egressor/ pony bottle - size of your choice (purchased separately).
  • CESA: Swim towards the surface while slowly breathing out (making the "aaaaaah" sound).

Who can use AirBuddy? Anyone who can swim, feels comfortable in the water, is willing to learn and obey the diving rules and procedures and has no medical conditions preventing them from diving with compressed air.

But at the end of the day, YOU are the ultimate guardian of your own safety. Proper dive training is crucial for your comfort and safety. Dive responsibly, know your limits and never go to a depth you don't feel comfortable ascending from in case of an emergency, certainly not without any 100% redundant back-up system. And remember, it is always a good idea to practise your first dives with AirBuddy in waist level water and then slowly progress as you gain more experience and confidence.

AirBuddy comes with additional safety backup features and our online support system - watch our FREE instruction videos that explain the key diving principles and safety rules.

More Safety Features:

  • (1) Large 15L air reservoir provides emergency air for safe return to the surface.
  • (2) Low battery level monitor and alarm starts sending out audible signals when the battery voltage drops below 11V (about 45 min of operation). This is the signal for you to ascend.
  • (3) Visible float and diving flag to mark your position to boats, fishermen, etc. 
  • (4) Detachable magnetic wristband with a switch to ensure that only you (the diver) can switch AirBuddy off. 
  • (5) Abrasion and kink resistant air hose made from strong polyurethane that limits the depth of your descend.
  • (6) Elaborate air ways with 3x snorkel assembly to prevent splash water reaching the compressor.
  • (7) Capsize protection to about 110° tilt with the weight mass in the lower section acting as a keel and an electronic system to prevent water ingress.

 

 

AirBuddy comes with a charger so instead of complicated air tank refills, simply recharge the battery from a power outlet (battery is fully recharged in 3.5hrs) at home, on your boat or even a campervan - just like you do with your mobile or camera! For a second consecutive dive with AirBuddy, use an additional battery (that weighs only 2.9kg).

And the best part? Your costs of operation are limited to the electricity you use (about $0.1 per recharge) and an occasional maintenance every few years (or round a hundred dives), meaning you save thousands of dollars over the lifetime of the gear. The battery is rated to retain more than 80% of its capacity even after 1,500 cycles!

AirBuddy provides a flat cost structure. The gear costs and maintenance costs are comparable with mid-range SCUBA gear. The difference is that you don't pay any rental or air-refill costs (and logistics) each time you go diving. You just recharge the battery from a socket for about 10 cents. This makes diving affordable, with significant savings over the time.

 

Fun fact: Surface-supplied diving (SSBA) has been around for longer than SCUBA, the first divers explored the sea bed in their funny looking dive suits with large brass helmets already back in the 19th century. 

We combined this almost 200-year old diving principle with the latest technologies, materials and innovations and created a compact, user-friendly unit.

AirBuddy is unique in the way it's bridging the gap between snorkeling and SCUBA. Whereas SCUBA (or rebreathers) are virtually irreplaceable on deep dives or dives with overhang (caves, wrecks), AirBuddy is perfect for hassle-free shallow water dives. Same sport, different use case, different gear. Just like road bike vs. mountain bike or cross country ski vs. downhill ski.

 

We designed AirBuddy for maximum performance, comfort, and safety at the minimum weight and size. Because stowability and transportability matter, too. Now you can take your dive gear anywhere you want. AirBuddy weighs 9.5kg (21lbs) in total. Out of this, the recoil hose, vest and regulator weigh about 1.7kg (3.7lbs) and the main unit weighs 7.8kg (17.2lbs).

Every part has been precisely engineered and has gone through many rounds of testing and improvements. We are also proud to be holding a patent for the six key innovations we made for: compressor cooling, battery, underwater signalling, secure switching, the air hose, and the air reservoir.

 

We began working on AirBuddy back in 2013 when we realised the potential of SSBA for self-guided recreational shallow water diving. Unable to find the right product on the market for our underwater explorations in Sydney and on our travels, we set out the goal to build a small, light-weight and easy to use dive gear. This is how AirBuddy compares to other recreational SSBA:

 

Each AirBuddy comes in a package that consists of: compressor unit, pressure reservoir (float), supply hose, harness and regulator, battery, charger, dive flag (american/ alpha), magnetic switch (bracelet), velcro straps (float attachment) and battery transport case.

You are ready to hit the beach the very same day you unpack your AirBuddy from the box. Just charge the battery, pack your fins, mask and weights, and you're ready to dive in no time.

While our primary focus at the moment remains on the core product (AirBuddy), there is a range of ideas for add-on features and accessories that we have evaluated for the future. One exciting feature is GPS tracking that will enable you to review your dive path and share with others. We also keep an eye on the fast advancing solar charging technology to become feasible for charging AirBuddy in remote locations.

 

We are a team of passionate divers, mechanical engineers and experienced entrepreneurs. AirBuddy was designed by divers, for divers.

We believe that the world can be continuously improved if you understand people and give them something that combines great design, a bit of clever invention and is fun to use. Together, we have four decades of experience in business, engineering and design and collectively hold 6 master's degrees.

We developed AirBuddy to brings the ease of snorkeling into the fascinating world of diving. Our mission is to help more people to explore and appreciate the beauty of our marine life.

Just charge the battery, pack your fins, mask and weights, and you're ready to dive in no time.While our primary focus at the moment remains on the core product (AirBuddy), there is a range of ideas for add-on features and accessories that we have evaluated for the future. One exciting feature is GPS tracking that will enable you to review your dive path and share with others. We also keep an eye on the fast advancing solar charging technology to become feasible for charging AirBuddy in remote locations. We are a team of passionate divers, mechanical engineers and experienced entrepreneurs. AirBuddy was designed by divers, for divers.We believe that the world can be continuously improved if you understand people and give them something that combines great design, a bit of clever invention and is fun to use. Together, we have four decades of experience in business, engineering and design and collectively hold 6 master's degrees.We developed AirBuddy to brings the ease of snorkeling into the fascinating world of diving. Our mission is to help more people to explore and appreciate the beauty of our marine life.

story:
Relax in the 21st Century 

Nothing beats a spontaneous trip with friends to the beach, campgrounds, or a tailgate... until you realize you need to unpack the car.

Chairs, speakers, towels, tables, and coolers. My friends and I looked at all of the junk we were lugging around and thought: what if this could all be put into one sleek, lightweight package?

Meet Shaze.

For the last year, we've worked on condensing all of our favorite features into an all-in-one lounge chair perfect for the beach, your next tailgate, or your next camping trip.

Core Features


 

  • 4 High-Quality Waterproof Speakers: Listen to music on the beach without worrying about your stereo, thanks to Shaze's IPX6 Waterproof Standard Rating. The video in our gallery shows off how good they sound!

  • USB Device Charger: For those moments when you need to post one more photo but your phone is on its last legs. Shaze's internal power bank can bring 4 dead cell phones back to 100%!

  • Drainable, Insulated Cooler: Never go thirsty or hungry again. Room for 6+ beverages and a couple of sandwiches, with durable fabric and a handy drain spigot to get rid of that ice water in seconds.

  • Secure Storage Box with Combination Lock: Never hide money in your shoe again. Shaze has a three-digit combination lockbox that can do a better job protecting your valuables than any backpack.

  • Stretchable Towel Holder: No more sandy towels... when it's time to dry off, grab it right off of your beach chair. Simple placement behind the chair headrest keeps it out of the way but within reach.

Our lounge has a weight capacity of 300 pounds, and the dimensions 19W x 30H x 26L.
 

A Durable, Powerful Battery

Shaze's built-in, rechargeable 10,000 milliamp battery that lasts for more than 5 hours of continuous use, so you can keep your phone charged and speaker booming. All of the electronics work in extreme climates, including subzero temperatures and over 200 degrees Fahrenheit.

      

It's also extremely easy to charge the battery, with a removable power bank so you don't have to set the chair up near outlets. We've also created a solar charging panel that plugs directly into the chair (more on that below).
 

Light. Water-Resistant. Rust-Proof.

There's no use having all this tech if you can't carry it anywhere. Shaze weighs only 10 pounds and comes with two back straps, making it as easy to carry as a backpack.

Oh, and no worries at the beach. Shaze is water-resistant too.
 

Three Awesome Colors


Shaze comes in three colors: Navy Blue, Camouflage, and Pastel Pink. Choose your color after checkout!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Now that we've finished the development process and brought Shaze to life, we're hoping you'll come along for the journey by helping us make it even better and fund our first round of production.

$25,000: Reduce Chair Weight

  • We have an extremely lightweight chair now at 10lbs, but we know we can do better. We are working on bringing that down at least 10% before we begin to ship.

$150,000: Extra Battery

  • Our solar panels were created to keep your Shaze battery charged all day without plugging it in (see the 'Perks' section). Making this solar panel smaller will allow it to stay permanently attached to your chair.
  • If we reach our stretch goal of $150,000 every order that was placed gets an extra 5,000 Mah battery built specifically for the Shaze lounge chair.

 

Perks

We've got a few great options for people who want to help us with this project. 

Early Bird Pricing: Get it while it's hot! Early backers will get the Shaze chair at only $55, half of the estimated retail cost.

Personalized Pillow: Make Shaze your own with a personal monogram. Initials, team names, phrases, or whatever else you want can be monogrammed onto the pillow of your chair.

Attachable Table: We've developed a special table that fits onto the Shaze chair like a glove. Available in the Deluxe Edition Package.

Solar Panel: Stay charged up all day with an attachable solar panel. Available in the Deluxe Edition Package.

Nala: Just kidding. You can't have Nala.

 

Retailers Information

Interested in selling the SHAZE chair in your store?

Great! Just click on the button below to email us with your info.

 

The Team

We are five entrepreneurs with over 30 years of experience between us bringing products to the market. The SHAZE chair has been our focus for the past 18 months and we are excited to finally bring our idea to fruition. 

 

FAQ

1. Do you ship worldwide?

No, currently we only ship to the United States, Canada, and Mexico. 

2. When can I choose the color of my SHAZE?

After your purchase, we will send out an email in which you can select your color.

3. When will I receive my SHAZE?

We can guarantee that the first 5,000 chairs will be shipped before the end of May 2017. After that, we will continue to ship based on incoming orders. 

4. How long does the SHAZE chair battery last?

On a single charge, the SHAZE can play music through the speakers for 8 hours or fully charge your phone 4 times over. Simlutaneous use (phone and speakers), our current battery works for 5+ hours.

5. What is the maximum weight capacity for a SHAZE lounge chair?

The lounge chair was created to support a bigger person. It can easily withstand the force of a 300 lb human (or any other mammal). 

6. What are the dimensions of the SHAZE chair?

19W x 30H x 26L

7. Where can I use my SHAZE?

SHAZE chairs were designed to be used all year long for a multitude of activities. You can bring your SHAZE to the beach, ball games, fishing, tailgating, camping, and even the bottom of a ski slope while you sip on hot cider. 

8. Is the SHAZE actually waterproof?

Yes, the SHAZE has IPX6 Waterproofing. So if you feel like sitting out in the rain for a week listening to music, you're good. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We definitely understand that some people can't contribute... but that doesn't mean you can't help! We'd love if you could help us get the word out by making some noise about our campaign. 

Spread Shaze on your social networks and pass it around your friend group via email.

Wishing you the best,

The Shaze Team

story:
Short Summary

  • We are a group hoping to bring business to a growing community of odinists and viking enthusiasts
  • We will make you shields and gear for you and your people for now we are working towards making shields as a main focus but will eventually make more.
  • You will make all our dreams and help kindreds everywhere with affordable gear and ideas.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $2500 at the minimum to get all our items and tools costing around $1000 and more to get our prototypes and website up and get some stock on items.
  • Custom engravings all hand crafted round viking style shields
  • Funds go straight to tools and materials if we dont reach our goal we will make it happen through continued saving.

The Impact

  • It will help not only the people involved in the project but our family our kindred and give more recognition to vikings and odinist altogether
  • This is our first project.

Risks & Challenges

  • Passion, Dedication and a responsibilty to ourselves and you to complete something we love is our biggest risk and fear of failure.
  • Through donations, kindness and respect to each other we can overcome any challenge.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Make us known if you have similar ideas and a audience or people who want to know more keep following us and your time, help and reach will be recognized.
  • Use the Indiegogo Share tools.
